description: PA chest radiograph showing normal cardiomediastinal silhouette, clear bilateral lung fields, normal hilar structures, and no acute osseous abnormalities. The trachea is midline and the diaphragm contours are normal.
Chest X-ray demonstrating dense airspace opacity in the right lower lobe with air bronchograms, consistent with lobar pneumonia. The right hemidiaphragm is partially obscured.
Frontal chest radiograph showing enlargement of the cardiac silhouette with a cardiothoracic ratio exceeding 0.5, suggestive of cardiomegaly. Mild pulmonary vascular congestion noted.
Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral blunting of the costophrenic angles with meniscus signs, consistent with bilateral pleural effusions. Moderate in size on the right, small on the left.
Upright chest radiograph showing absence of lung markings in the left apex with a visible visceral pleural line, consistent with a left-sided pneumothorax approximately 20% in size.
Chest X-ray showing a well-defined, round opacity in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 1.5 cm. Margins appear smooth. Follow-up CT recommended for further characterization.
Chest radiograph demonstrating a non-displaced fracture of the right 7th rib laterally. No associated pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Soft tissue swelling noted at the fracture site.
PA chest X-ray showing increased opacity behind the left heart border with volume loss and elevation of the left hemidiaphragm, consistent with left lower lobe atelectasis.
Chest radiograph showing hyperinflated lungs with flattened diaphragms, increased retrosternal airspace, and prominent interstitial markings consistent with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral perihilar haziness with Kerley B lines and peribronchial cuffing, consistent with pulmonary edema. Mild cardiomegaly also noted.
Axial T2-weighted MRI of the brain showing normal grey-white matter differentiation, normal ventricular system, no midline shift, and no acute intracranial pathology identified.

MRI brain with contrast showing a large heterogeneously enhancing mass in the right temporal lobe with surrounding vasogenic edema and mass effect on the lateral ventricle, suspicious for high-grade glioma.
Diffusion-weighted MRI showing restricted diffusion in the left middle cerebral artery territory, consistent with acute ischemic infarction. ADC map confirms true restricted diffusion.

T2 FLAIR MRI of the brain demonstrating multiple periventricular and juxtacortical hyperintense lesions, with ovoid morphology perpendicular to the ventricles (Dawson fingers), consistent with demyelinating disease.
Sagittal T2-weighted MRI of the lumbar spine showing posterior disc herniation at L4-L5 with compression of the traversing L5 nerve root. Mild disc desiccation at multiple levels.
Sagittal MRI of the knee showing complete discontinuity of the anterior cruciate ligament with surrounding edema and joint effusion. The PCL appears intact.
Coronal T2 fat-sat MRI of the shoulder demonstrating a full-thickness tear of the supraspinatus tendon with 1.5 cm retraction. Moderate subacromial-subdeltoid bursitis noted.
Contrast-enhanced MRI of the abdomen showing arterial enhancement and venous washout of a 4 cm mass in the right hepatic lobe, consistent with hepatocellular carcinoma in a background of cirrhosis.
Chest X-ray showing upper lobe fibronodular opacities bilaterally with possible cavitation in the right apex. Findings are concerning for active or reactivation pulmonary tuberculosis.
AP full-spine radiograph demonstrating a right thoracic scoliosis with a Cobb angle of approximately 25 degrees centered at T8. Mild rotational deformity of the vertebral bodies noted.
Post-contrast MRI of the brain showing a well-defined, homogeneously enhancing extra-axial mass along the right convexity with a dural tail sign, consistent with meningioma.
Lateral chest radiograph showing a retrocardiac soft tissue density with an air-fluid level projecting above the diaphragm, consistent with a hiatal hernia.
Chest X-ray showing a flask-shaped cardiac silhouette with smooth borders and clear lung fields, suggestive of pericardial effusion. Echocardiographic correlation recommended.
Sagittal MRI of the knee showing a complex tear of the posterior horn of the medial meniscus extending to the inferior articular surface. Moderate joint effusion present.
Axial T2 MRI at L4-L5 showing severe central canal stenosis with ligamentum flavum hypertrophy and facet joint arthropathy causing significant thecal sac compression.
Chest radiograph showing a large, irregularly marginated mass in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 5 cm. Mediastinal widening suggests possible lymphadenopathy. CT staging recommended.
MRI brain showing marked dilatation of all four ventricles with periventricular signal change on T2/FLAIR, consistent with communicating hydrocephalus. Transependymal CSF flow noted.
AP and lateral knee radiographs showing joint space narrowing of the medial compartment with subchondral sclerosis, osteophyte formation, and small joint effusion consistent with osteoarthritis.
Non-contrast CT head showing a crescentic hyperdense collection along the left frontoparietal convexity with mild midline shift to the right, consistent with acute subdural hematoma.
Chest X-ray showing widening of the mediastinum and enlargement of the aortic knob. CTA recommended to evaluate for thoracic aortic aneurysm.
Sagittal T2 MRI of the cervical spine showing a large posterior disc herniation at C5-C6 with cord compression and intramedullary signal change suggesting myelopathy.
AP shoulder radiograph showing anterior dislocation of the humeral head from the glenoid fossa. No associated fracture of the greater tuberosity identified. Hill-Sachs lesion cannot be excluded.
MRI of the breast showing an irregular enhancing mass in the upper outer quadrant with washout kinetics on dynamic sequences, suspicious for malignancy. BI-RADS 4.
MRI of the knee showing intact cruciate and collateral ligaments, normal menisci, normal articular cartilage, and no significant joint effusion. No bone marrow edema identified.
Lateral wrist radiograph demonstrating a distal radius fracture with dorsal angulation and displacement, consistent with a Colles fracture. No ulnar styloid fracture identified.

Sagittal post-contrast MRI of the sella showing a 12mm enhancing mass arising from the pituitary gland with suprasellar extension and mild compression of the optic chiasm, consistent with pituitary macroadenoma.
Chest X-ray showing bilateral reticular opacities predominantly in the lower lobes with reduced lung volumes, consistent with interstitial lung disease. HRCT recommended for further evaluation.

AP and lateral ankle radiographs showing a displaced fracture of the lateral malleolus with widening of the medial clear space, consistent with a Weber B ankle fracture with possible deltoid ligament injury.
MRA of the brain showing a 7mm saccular aneurysm arising from the anterior communicating artery complex. No evidence of recent hemorrhage on accompanying sequences.
Chest radiograph showing bilateral upper lobe predominant hyperinflation with bullous changes, flattened hemidiaphragms, and increased AP diameter consistent with centrilobular emphysema.
MRI abdomen showing a 3.5 cm enhancing solid mass arising from the upper pole of the left kidney with heterogeneous signal on T2-weighted sequences, suspicious for renal cell carcinoma.
MRI of the lumbar spine showing normal vertebral body height and signal, intact intervertebral discs with normal hydration, patent spinal canal, and no compression of neural elements.
Supine chest radiograph showing complete opacification of the left hemithorax with mediastinal shift to the right and inversion of the left hemidiaphragm, consistent with tension pneumothorax.
MRI abdomen showing a dilated, fluid-filled appendix measuring 12mm with periappendiceal fat stranding and enhancement, consistent with acute appendicitis. No perforation identified.
AP pelvis radiograph showing a displaced intracapsular fracture of the left femoral neck with superior displacement of the femoral shaft. Garden classification type III.
Post-contrast MRI showing a 2cm enhancing mass in the left cerebellopontine angle extending into the internal auditory canal, consistent with vestibular schwannoma (acoustic neuroma).
Chest X-ray demonstrating linear lucencies outlining the mediastinal structures and extending into the soft tissues of the neck, consistent with pneumomediastinum. No pneumothorax identified.
Pelvic MRI showing a 5cm well-defined cystic lesion arising from the right ovary with thin walls, no solid component, and homogeneous T2 bright signal, consistent with a simple ovarian cyst.
Lateral thoracic spine radiograph showing anterior wedging of T12 vertebral body with approximately 40% height loss, consistent with a compression fracture. MRI recommended to assess acuity.
Post-contrast MRI of the brain showing normal parenchymal signal, no abnormal enhancement, patent dural venous sinuses, normal pituitary gland, and no extra-axial collections.

AP shoulder radiograph showing anterior dislocation of the humeral head from the glenoid fossa. No associated fracture of the greater tuberosity identified. Hill-Sachs lesion cannot be excluded.
MRI of the breast showing an irregular enhancing mass in the upper outer quadrant with washout kinetics on dynamic sequences, suspicious for malignancy. BI-RADS 4.

Sagittal post-contrast MRI of the sella showing a 12mm enhancing mass arising from the pituitary gland with suprasellar extension and mild compression of the optic chiasm, consistent with pituitary macroadenoma.

AP and lateral ankle radiographs showing a displaced fracture of the lateral malleolus with widening of the medial clear space, consistent with a Weber B ankle fracture with possible deltoid ligament injury.
MRA of the brain showing a 7mm saccular aneurysm arising from the anterior communicating artery complex. No evidence of recent hemorrhage on accompanying sequences.
Chest radiograph showing bilateral upper lobe predominant hyperinflation with bullous changes, flattened hemidiaphragms, and increased AP diameter consistent with centrilobular emphysema.
MRI abdomen showing a 3.5 cm enhancing solid mass arising from the upper pole of the left kidney with heterogeneous signal on T2-weighted sequences, suspicious for renal cell carcinoma.

AP pelvis radiograph showing a displaced intracapsular fracture of the left femoral neck with superior displacement of the femoral shaft. Garden classification type III.
Post-contrast MRI showing a 2cm enhancing mass in the left cerebellopontine angle extending into the internal auditory canal, consistent with vestibular schwannoma (acoustic neuroma).

PA chest radiograph showing normal cardiomediastinal silhouette, clear bilateral lung fields, normal hilar structures, and no acute osseous abnormalities. The trachea is midline and the diaphragm contours are normal.
Chest X-ray demonstrating dense airspace opacity in the right lower lobe with air bronchograms, consistent with lobar pneumonia. The right hemidiaphragm is partially obscured.
Frontal chest radiograph showing enlargement of the cardiac silhouette with a cardiothoracic ratio exceeding 0.5, suggestive of cardiomegaly. Mild pulmonary vascular congestion noted.
Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral blunting of the costophrenic angles with meniscus signs, consistent with bilateral pleural effusions. Moderate in size on the right, small on the left.
Upright chest radiograph showing absence of lung markings in the left apex with a visible visceral pleural line, consistent with a left-sided pneumothorax approximately 20% in size.
Chest X-ray showing a well-defined, round opacity in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 1.5 cm. Margins appear smooth. Follow-up CT recommended for further characterization.
Chest radiograph demonstrating a non-displaced fracture of the right 7th rib laterally. No associated pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Soft tissue swelling noted at the fracture site.
PA chest X-ray showing increased opacity behind the left heart border with volume loss and elevation of the left hemidiaphragm, consistent with left lower lobe atelectasis.
Chest radiograph showing hyperinflated lungs with flattened diaphragms, increased retrosternal airspace, and prominent interstitial markings consistent with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral perihilar haziness with Kerley B lines and peribronchial cuffing, consistent with pulmonary edema. Mild cardiomegaly also noted.
Axial T2-weighted MRI of the brain showing normal grey-white matter differentiation, normal ventricular system, no midline shift, and no acute intracranial pathology identified.

MRI brain with contrast showing a large heterogeneously enhancing mass in the right temporal lobe with surrounding vasogenic edema and mass effect on the lateral ventricle, suspicious for high-grade glioma.
Diffusion-weighted MRI showing restricted diffusion in the left middle cerebral artery territory, consistent with acute ischemic infarction. ADC map confirms true restricted diffusion.

T2 FLAIR MRI of the brain demonstrating multiple periventricular and juxtacortical hyperintense lesions, with ovoid morphology perpendicular to the ventricles (Dawson fingers), consistent with demyelinating disease.
Sagittal T2-weighted MRI of the lumbar spine showing posterior disc herniation at L4-L5 with compression of the traversing L5 nerve root. Mild disc desiccation at multiple levels.
Sagittal MRI of the knee showing complete discontinuity of the anterior cruciate ligament with surrounding edema and joint effusion. The PCL appears intact.
Coronal T2 fat-sat MRI of the shoulder demonstrating a full-thickness tear of the supraspinatus tendon with 1.5 cm retraction. Moderate subacromial-subdeltoid bursitis noted.
Contrast-enhanced MRI of the abdomen showing arterial enhancement and venous washout of a 4 cm mass in the right hepatic lobe, consistent with hepatocellular carcinoma in a background of cirrhosis.
Chest X-ray showing upper lobe fibronodular opacities bilaterally with possible cavitation in the right apex. Findings are concerning for active or reactivation pulmonary tuberculosis.
AP full-spine radiograph demonstrating a right thoracic scoliosis with a Cobb angle of approximately 25 degrees centered at T8. Mild rotational deformity of the vertebral bodies noted.
Post-contrast MRI of the brain showing a well-defined, homogeneously enhancing extra-axial mass along the right convexity with a dural tail sign, consistent with meningioma.
Lateral chest radiograph showing a retrocardiac soft tissue density with an air-fluid level projecting above the diaphragm, consistent with a hiatal hernia.
Chest X-ray showing a flask-shaped cardiac silhouette with smooth borders and clear lung fields, suggestive of pericardial effusion. Echocardiographic correlation recommended.
Sagittal MRI of the knee showing a complex tear of the posterior horn of the medial meniscus extending to the inferior articular surface. Moderate joint effusion present.
Axial T2 MRI at L4-L5 showing severe central canal stenosis with ligamentum flavum hypertrophy and facet joint arthropathy causing significant thecal sac compression.
Chest radiograph showing a large, irregularly marginated mass in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 5 cm. Mediastinal widening suggests possible lymphadenopathy. CT staging recommended.
MRI brain showing marked dilatation of all four ventricles with periventricular signal change on T2/FLAIR, consistent with communicating hydrocephalus. Transependymal CSF flow noted.

Non-contrast CT head showing a crescentic hyperdense collection along the left frontoparietal convexity with mild midline shift to the right, consistent with acute subdural hematoma.
Chest X-ray showing widening of the mediastinum and enlargement of the aortic knob. CTA recommended to evaluate for thoracic aortic aneurysm.
Sagittal T2 MRI of the cervical spine showing a large posterior disc herniation at C5-C6 with cord compression and intramedullary signal change suggesting myelopathy.
AP shoulder radiograph showing anterior dislocation of the humeral head from the glenoid fossa. No associated fracture of the greater tuberosity identified. Hill-Sachs lesion cannot be excluded.
MRI of the breast showing an irregular enhancing mass in the upper outer quadrant with washout kinetics on dynamic sequences, suspicious for malignancy. BI-RADS 4.

Coronal T2 fat-sat MRI of the shoulder demonstrating a full-thickness tear of the supraspinatus tendon with 1.5 cm retraction. Moderate subacromial-subdeltoid bursitis noted.
Contrast-enhanced MRI of the abdomen showing arterial enhancement and venous washout of a 4 cm mass in the right hepatic lobe, consistent with hepatocellular carcinoma in a background of cirrhosis.
Chest X-ray showing upper lobe fibronodular opacities bilaterally with possible cavitation in the right apex. Findings are concerning for active or reactivation pulmonary tuberculosis.
AP full-spine radiograph demonstrating a right thoracic scoliosis with a Cobb angle of approximately 25 degrees centered at T8. Mild rotational deformity of the vertebral bodies noted.
Post-contrast MRI of the brain showing a well-defined, homogeneously enhancing extra-axial mass along the right convexity with a dural tail sign, consistent with meningioma.
Lateral chest radiograph showing a retrocardiac soft tissue density with an air-fluid level projecting above the diaphragm, consistent with a hiatal hernia.
Chest X-ray showing a flask-shaped cardiac silhouette with smooth borders and clear lung fields, suggestive of pericardial effusion. Echocardiographic correlation recommended.
Sagittal MRI of the knee showing a complex tear of the posterior horn of the medial meniscus extending to the inferior articular surface. Moderate joint effusion present.
Axial T2 MRI at L4-L5 showing severe central canal stenosis with ligamentum flavum hypertrophy and facet joint arthropathy causing significant thecal sac compression.
Chest radiograph showing a large, irregularly marginated mass in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 5 cm. Mediastinal widening suggests possible lymphadenopathy. CT staging recommended.
MRI brain showing marked dilatation of all four ventricles with periventricular signal change on T2/FLAIR, consistent with communicating hydrocephalus. Transependymal CSF flow noted.
AP and lateral knee radiographs showing joint space narrowing of the medial compartment with subchondral sclerosis, osteophyte formation, and small joint effusion consistent with osteoarthritis.
Non-contrast CT head showing a crescentic hyperdense collection along the left frontoparietal convexity with mild midline shift to the right, consistent with acute subdural hematoma.
Chest X-ray showing widening of the mediastinum and enlargement of the aortic knob. CTA recommended to evaluate for thoracic aortic aneurysm.
Sagittal T2 MRI of the cervical spine showing a large posterior disc herniation at C5-C6 with cord compression and intramedullary signal change suggesting myelopathy.
AP shoulder radiograph showing anterior dislocation of the humeral head from the glenoid fossa. No associated fracture of the greater tuberosity identified. Hill-Sachs lesion cannot be excluded.
MRI of the breast showing an irregular enhancing mass in the upper outer quadrant with washout kinetics on dynamic sequences, suspicious for malignancy. BI-RADS 4.
MRI of the knee showing intact cruciate and collateral ligaments, normal menisci, normal articular cartilage, and no significant joint effusion. No bone marrow edema identified.
Lateral wrist radiograph demonstrating a distal radius fracture with dorsal angulation and displacement, consistent with a Colles fracture. No ulnar styloid fracture identified.

Sagittal post-contrast MRI of the sella showing a 12mm enhancing mass arising from the pituitary gland with suprasellar extension and mild compression of the optic chiasm, consistent with pituitary macroadenoma.
Chest X-ray showing bilateral reticular opacities predominantly in the lower lobes with reduced lung volumes, consistent with interstitial lung disease. HRCT recommended for further evaluation.

AP and lateral ankle radiographs showing a displaced fracture of the lateral malleolus with widening of the medial clear space, consistent with a Weber B ankle fracture with possible deltoid ligament injury.
MRA of the brain showing a 7mm saccular aneurysm arising from the anterior communicating artery complex. No evidence of recent hemorrhage on accompanying sequences.
Chest radiograph showing bilateral upper lobe predominant hyperinflation with bullous changes, flattened hemidiaphragms, and increased AP diameter consistent with centrilobular emphysema.
MRI abdomen showing a 3.5 cm enhancing solid mass arising from the upper pole of the left kidney with heterogeneous signal on T2-weighted sequences, suspicious for renal cell carcinoma.
MRI of the lumbar spine showing normal vertebral body height and signal, intact intervertebral discs with normal hydration, patent spinal canal, and no compression of neural elements.
Supine chest radiograph showing complete opacification of the left hemithorax with mediastinal shift to the right and inversion of the left hemidiaphragm, consistent with tension pneumothorax.

AP pelvis radiograph showing a displaced intracapsular fracture of the left femoral neck with superior displacement of the femoral shaft. Garden classification type III.
Post-contrast MRI showing a 2cm enhancing mass in the left cerebellopontine angle extending into the internal auditory canal, consistent with vestibular schwannoma (acoustic neuroma).
Chest X-ray demonstrating linear lucencies outlining the mediastinal structures and extending into the soft tissues of the neck, consistent with pneumomediastinum. No pneumothorax identified.

Axial T2 MRI at L4-L5 showing severe central canal stenosis with ligamentum flavum hypertrophy and facet joint arthropathy causing significant thecal sac compression.
Chest radiograph showing a large, irregularly marginated mass in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 5 cm. Mediastinal widening suggests possible lymphadenopathy. CT staging recommended.
MRI brain showing marked dilatation of all four ventricles with periventricular signal change on T2/FLAIR, consistent with communicating hydrocephalus. Transependymal CSF flow noted.
AP and lateral knee radiographs showing joint space narrowing of the medial compartment with subchondral sclerosis, osteophyte formation, and small joint effusion consistent with osteoarthritis.
Non-contrast CT head showing a crescentic hyperdense collection along the left frontoparietal convexity with mild midline shift to the right, consistent with acute subdural hematoma.
Chest X-ray showing widening of the mediastinum and enlargement of the aortic knob. CTA recommended to evaluate for thoracic aortic aneurysm.
Sagittal T2 MRI of the cervical spine showing a large posterior disc herniation at C5-C6 with cord compression and intramedullary signal change suggesting myelopathy.
AP shoulder radiograph showing anterior dislocation of the humeral head from the glenoid fossa. No associated fracture of the greater tuberosity identified. Hill-Sachs lesion cannot be excluded.
MRI of the breast showing an irregular enhancing mass in the upper outer quadrant with washout kinetics on dynamic sequences, suspicious for malignancy. BI-RADS 4.
MRI of the knee showing intact cruciate and collateral ligaments, normal menisci, normal articular cartilage, and no significant joint effusion. No bone marrow edema identified.
Lateral wrist radiograph demonstrating a distal radius fracture with dorsal angulation and displacement, consistent with a Colles fracture. No ulnar styloid fracture identified.

Sagittal post-contrast MRI of the sella showing a 12mm enhancing mass arising from the pituitary gland with suprasellar extension and mild compression of the optic chiasm, consistent with pituitary macroadenoma.
Chest X-ray showing bilateral reticular opacities predominantly in the lower lobes with reduced lung volumes, consistent with interstitial lung disease. HRCT recommended for further evaluation.

AP and lateral ankle radiographs showing a displaced fracture of the lateral malleolus with widening of the medial clear space, consistent with a Weber B ankle fracture with possible deltoid ligament injury.
MRA of the brain showing a 7mm saccular aneurysm arising from the anterior communicating artery complex. No evidence of recent hemorrhage on accompanying sequences.
Chest radiograph showing bilateral upper lobe predominant hyperinflation with bullous changes, flattened hemidiaphragms, and increased AP diameter consistent with centrilobular emphysema.
MRI abdomen showing a 3.5 cm enhancing solid mass arising from the upper pole of the left kidney with heterogeneous signal on T2-weighted sequences, suspicious for renal cell carcinoma.
MRI of the lumbar spine showing normal vertebral body height and signal, intact intervertebral discs with normal hydration, patent spinal canal, and no compression of neural elements.
Supine chest radiograph showing complete opacification of the left hemithorax with mediastinal shift to the right and inversion of the left hemidiaphragm, consistent with tension pneumothorax.
MRI abdomen showing a dilated, fluid-filled appendix measuring 12mm with periappendiceal fat stranding and enhancement, consistent with acute appendicitis. No perforation identified.
AP pelvis radiograph showing a displaced intracapsular fracture of the left femoral neck with superior displacement of the femoral shaft. Garden classification type III.
Post-contrast MRI showing a 2cm enhancing mass in the left cerebellopontine angle extending into the internal auditory canal, consistent with vestibular schwannoma (acoustic neuroma).
Chest X-ray demonstrating linear lucencies outlining the mediastinal structures and extending into the soft tissues of the neck, consistent with pneumomediastinum. No pneumothorax identified.
Pelvic MRI showing a 5cm well-defined cystic lesion arising from the right ovary with thin walls, no solid component, and homogeneous T2 bright signal, consistent with a simple ovarian cyst.
Lateral thoracic spine radiograph showing anterior wedging of T12 vertebral body with approximately 40% height loss, consistent with a compression fracture. MRI recommended to assess acuity.
Post-contrast MRI of the brain showing normal parenchymal signal, no abnormal enhancement, patent dural venous sinuses, normal pituitary gland, and no extra-axial collections.

PA chest radiograph showing normal cardiomediastinal silhouette, clear bilateral lung fields, normal hilar structures, and no acute osseous abnormalities. The trachea is midline and the diaphragm contours are normal.
Chest X-ray demonstrating dense airspace opacity in the right lower lobe with air bronchograms, consistent with lobar pneumonia. The right hemidiaphragm is partially obscured.
Frontal chest radiograph showing enlargement of the cardiac silhouette with a cardiothoracic ratio exceeding 0.5, suggestive of cardiomegaly. Mild pulmonary vascular congestion noted.
Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral blunting of the costophrenic angles with meniscus signs, consistent with bilateral pleural effusions. Moderate in size on the right, small on the left.
Upright chest radiograph showing absence of lung markings in the left apex with a visible visceral pleural line, consistent with a left-sided pneumothorax approximately 20% in size.
Chest X-ray showing a well-defined, round opacity in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 1.5 cm. Margins appear smooth. Follow-up CT recommended for further characterization.
Chest radiograph demonstrating a non-displaced fracture of the right 7th rib laterally. No associated pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Soft tissue swelling noted at the fracture site.
PA chest X-ray showing increased opacity behind the left heart border with volume loss and elevation of the left hemidiaphragm, consistent with left lower lobe atelectasis.
Chest radiograph showing hyperinflated lungs with flattened diaphragms, increased retrosternal airspace, and prominent interstitial markings consistent with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
Chest X-ray demonstrating bilateral perihilar haziness with Kerley B lines and peribronchial cuffing, consistent with pulmonary edema. Mild cardiomegaly also noted.
Axial T2-weighted MRI of the brain showing normal grey-white matter differentiation, normal ventricular system, no midline shift, and no acute intracranial pathology identified.

MRI brain with contrast showing a large heterogeneously enhancing mass in the right temporal lobe with surrounding vasogenic edema and mass effect on the lateral ventricle, suspicious for high-grade glioma.
Diffusion-weighted MRI showing restricted diffusion in the left middle cerebral artery territory, consistent with acute ischemic infarction. ADC map confirms true restricted diffusion.

T2 FLAIR MRI of the brain demonstrating multiple periventricular and juxtacortical hyperintense lesions, with ovoid morphology perpendicular to the ventricles (Dawson fingers), consistent with demyelinating disease.
